intro: Salicornia mossambicensis, commonly known as sea beans, is a halophytic plant adapted to saline environments. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. This species is typically found in coastal areas, salt marshes, and other saline habitats. Its ability to thrive in high-salt conditions makes it an important component of coastal ecosystems. Salicornia mossambicensis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
